amendment.description: Amendment sought to increase funding for the Superfund program by $440 million and reduce funding for FEMA disaster relief by $186 million.
amendment.purpose: An amendment, printed as amendment No. 38 in the Congressional Record of July 26, 1995, to increase the funds appropriated in the bill for the Superfund program by $440 million. The increase would be offset by funding reductions for the FEMA disaster relief by $186 million.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Dingell amendment (A022) Failed by recorded vote: 155 - 261 (Roll no. 603).
